From: Zara Rabinowicz
Sent: 04 March 2011 10:31
To: #LOCOG New Media; Kathryn Gilbert; Deborah Elstein
Subject: Link 2 us button redesigned

Hi,

This is just to keep you updated on the progress of the new Link2 us page.

You can navigate to it from the footer of the London2012 homepage and it takes you here;
http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/link-to-us/index.php

Buttons/Banners are available for anyone who wants to display them on their website and they link back to the L2012 homepage.
They come in three colours and multiple sizes, and users include everyone from Greenwich council to personal blogs.

We get a database of users, email addresses and websites, which is potentially useful in the future for sharing our message or updating them with information to share.

Cheers
Zara

Zara Rabinowicz

Hi Zara,

Is there anyway we can get all sizes in all colours? 

The new page has three options: size, colour, text (if the text is always the same that's fine we'll just drop it as an option).
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/get-involved/link-to-us/index.php

The sizes are fine ie. 1 folder per size, but some folders only have 2 colours, whereas other have all 6

In a perfect world for the interface we have designed we'd have 

160_200_pink_link_to_us.gif
160_200_orange_link_to_us.gif
160_200_green_link_to_us.gif

or just:

160_200_pink.gif
160_200_orange.gif
160_200_green.gif

The _V1 doesn't make much sense in terms of our 'select a colour menu' and as we using the options the user selects to build up the filename there needs to be some correlation, sorry we probably should have been more specific about the required filenames.

If we can only have some sizes in 2 or 3 colours then we may need to revisit what we have built for you so far, is there a consistent pattern where banners under a certain sizes only have 2 or 3 colours (I thinking if we can solve this programatically). 

thanks

Jamie

Hi Jamie
Thanks for letting me know- which ones do you need the extra colours/ sizes for? I’ll make sure to follow up with the person who sent them as soon as I get that.
Cheers
Zara

Hi Zara,

It would just be good to have some consistency, 

It looks like they're are blue, green and pink ones ion most folders but 6 styles for 100x100 and only 2 each (orange / pink) for 180x90 , 728x90 and 468x60.

* see attached screen shots

Would it be possible to just have a choice of 3 colours (blue/green/pink) in each size? 

and if possible name them 120-120/pink.gif (ie. pink.gif in a 120X120 folder) or just 120-120-pink.gif

This page should give an indication of how the selector work and therefor why we really need each size in each colour.
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/get-involved/link-to-us/index.php

I assume they all have the same text (haven't checked every one) in which case we'll take of the text option.

thnaks

Jamie

works fine in chrome

Hi. This problem was reported a couple of days ago by someone else. I
thought we had fixed it. Can you try refreshing the main Kitsite page (i.e.
the folder view) by pressing ctrl-R, and let me know if you still see the
problem please?
Thanks.
Kieran
P.S. If the problem *does* recur, can you send a screenshot - if possible?
Many thanks.
This is definitely still occuring for me - tried it quite a few times today now with refreshes inbetween. Attached a screen shot.

Hi. Apologies, a code upgrade we did last night (Tue) caused a recurrence of the previous problem (the one which I suggested I had already fixed!).
I have re-fixed it, and it should not recur. I would be grateful if you could double-check this please?
Many thanks,
Kieran
danny, have added 0.1 to time, although perhaps for political reasons it might want to be recorded elsewhere.
Perfect - works fine for me now, thanks!
